topic.title: HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade 2.1: Initializing and Configuring Controller1

titlealts.searchtitle: HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade 2.1: Initializing and Configuring Controller-1

body.p: You must assign a host as a second controller to provide redundancy for controller-0.
body.note: This feature applies only to KVM Region servers.
body.p: Before initializing a node, ensure that the following conditions are satisfied:

ul.li: The node must meet the hardware requirements for the personality to be assigned. For more information, see Hardware Requirements
Controller-0 must be installed and operational.
The node must be connected to the internal management network using an Ethernet interface configured for PXE boot.
The node must be configured in the BIOS to boot from the internal management network.

ol.li: Power on the node to be configured as Controller-1. To ensure you can correctly identify hosts as you install them, power on and configure each new node one at a time.
Launch the HP Helion OpenStack Horizon Dashboard.
Select the appropriate region and project.
Click the Admin dashboard, then the System panel, then the Inventory tab.
The new node is listed with an empty Host Name and Personality.

Assign the node's personality:
Click Edit Host for the new host.
In the Edit Host screen, select Controller from the Personality list.
Optional: Enter a physical Location for the node to help identify it.
Click Save to initialize and configure the new node.
The node is restarted automatically, and a display-device menu appears on the node console.

Optional: Select the display device to use during initialization. The personality (Controller, Compute, or Storage) is confirmed in the menu. If you do not change the selection, the default is applied automatically after a few seconds.
Serial <personality> Node Install (default) - Use the serial port to display messages. You can monitor the port using the terminal server.
Graphics <personality> Node Install - Use the console port in graphics mode to display messages. This selection works with most console displays.
Graphics Text <personality> Node Install - Use the console port in text mode to display messages. This is a safe option for nodes that do not support graphics mode.

Wait while the node is configured and rebooted.
After a few minutes, the node is reported as Locked, Disabled, and Online in the Hosts list.
Caution: To ensure a successful installation, wait for the node to be reported as Locked, Disabled, and Online, and ensure that the login prompt appears on the host console. If the process is interrupted prematurely, the host installation can fail.
The time required to configure and reboot controller-1 depends on the secondary disk partition size. Larger partitions require more time for synchronization with controller-0.
The host is now configured with a personality.

Configure the host so that it can be unlocked.
Before you can unlock a storage node, you must do the following:
Create storage volumes. For details, see Creating Storage Volumes.
If using LAG to attach to the management network, change the Interface Type for the management network interface to aggregated ethernet For more information, see Editing Interface Settings.
Configure the interface to the infrastructure network. For details, see Network Interface Provisioning.

Unlock the node to make it available for use. Click More then Unlock Host.
The node is rebooted, and its Availability State is reported as In-Test. After a few minutes, it is reported as Unlocked, Enabled, and Available.
